@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Normalization for pointer events. Pointer events are hardware-agnostic and
will be fired regardless of which input type of input device is used (e.g. mouse or touchscreen).

@require.name: @require
@require.body: (qx.module.event.Pointer#getPointerType) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced

@require.name: @require
@require.body: (qx.module.event.Pointer#getViewportLeft) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced

@require.name: @require
@require.body: (qx.module.event.Pointer#getViewportTop) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced

@require.name: @require
@require.body: (qx.module.event.Pointer#getDocumentLeft) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced

@require.name: @require
@require.body: (qx.module.event.Pointer#getDocumentTop) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced

@require.name: @require
@require.body: (qx.module.event.Pointer#getScreenLeft) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced

@require.name: @require
@require.body: (qx.module.event.Pointer#getScreenTop) // static code analysis - this method has to referenced

@description.name: @description
@description.body: List of event types to be normalized

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the device type which the event triggered. This can be one of the following strings: mouse, pen or touch.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get the horizontal coordinate at which the event occurred relative
to the viewport.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get the vertical coordinate at which the event occurred relative
to the viewport.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get the horizontal position at which the event occurred relative to the
left of the document. This property takes into account any scrolling of
the page.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number} The horizontal mouse position in the document.
@return.description: The horizontal mouse position in the document.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get the vertical position at which the event occurred relative to the
top of the document. This property takes into account any scrolling of
the page.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number} The vertical mouse position in the document.
@return.description: The vertical mouse position in the document.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get the horizontal coordinate at which the event occurred relative to
the origin of the screen coordinate system.

Note: This value is usually not very useful unless you want to
position a native popup window at this coordinate.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number} The horizontal mouse position on the screen.
@return.description: The horizontal mouse position on the screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Get the vertical coordinate at which the event occurred relative to
the origin of the screen coordinate system.

Note: This value is usually not very useful unless you want to
position a native popup window at this coordinate.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Number} The vertical mouse position on the screen.
@return.description: The vertical mouse position on the screen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Manipulates the native event object, adding methods if they're not
already present

@param.name: @param
@param.body: element {Element} DOM element the listener was attached to
@param.description: DOM element the listener was attached to
